url.jcd:desc: Archive of travel stories and photos.
Born.
1 year old.
2 years old.
3 years old.
4 years old.
5 years old.
12 years old : Skiing.
14 years old : A summer in Greece.
19 years old : Bike trip through Europe + Critical Mass San Francisco.
A few pics of old friends.
A few pics of friends and family.
San Francisco and Chapel Hill, North Carolina.
My first studio. Located at the worst intersection in San Francisco - 6th st. and Market.
Visit to my friend Chloe in Chapel Hill, North Carolina.
Exhibit of posters at a "Club Six".
Costumes.
House warming party at my place on Market St.
Chloe and Jonathan got bored one day... Yes, my humor even confuses me sometimes.
Chicago, Vancouver, BC. and Ski trip to Europe.
Photos from my ski trip to Switzerland and France. Johann in Aix en Provence and skiing in Zermat and Val D'Isere / Tignes.
Family trip to Chicago to see Nick.
Erica and Jonathan in Vancouver, (British Columbia) Canada.
San Francisco, a ski trip to Whistler Canada and few months in Brooklyn / Manhattan New York.
Ski trip to Whistler (British Columbia) Canada with Windsor.
Protesting the invasion of Iraq.
300 person party in my tiny apartment.
Johann Pauwen and Michaele Simmering. Providence, RI.
My brother Nick at school in Purchase New York.
3 and 1/2 months living in Brooklyn and then the East Village after moving away from San Francisco.
New Years in Madrid. 7 months in Portugal. Skiing the Alps, Amsterdam and making Absinthe. London, (Old) York, New York, Tokyo and Thailand.
New Years 2004 in Madrid!
Crans Montana, Switzerland and Chamonix, France.
Mercy and Erica in Amsterdam.
7 months in Lisbon and traveling around.
7 months in the Barrio Alto Neighborhood of Lisboa.
Johann and Michaele in Lisboa.
Beach.
150 year old recipe -- 150 proof moonshine with imported Dutch wormwood.
Sheila, Windsor visit Lisbon.
Beaches of the south.
A trip up to the birthplace of Port Wine.
A favorite hangout in Lisboa.
Photos of the beautiful apartment and other goodies :)
Visiting Richard and Cat -- the inspiration for my Asian travel frenzy to consume the next 2 years of my life.
A short stopover in NYC on my way back to San Francisco.
10 days in Tokyo on my way to Thailand.
Graffiti.
Beautifull national park and famous Toshogu shrines. North of Tokyo.
9 Weeks in Thailand. Beginning of a 6 month adventure in South East Asia. (sorry, section needs cleanup)
First gulp of South East Asia... Beginning of a 6 month overland adventure through the region. Would return numerous times to Bangkok after this.
Party Island and a "dark-moon" rave.
Dipped my toe into Myanmar... returned with a plan and a visa nearly 2 years later.
Northern city.
Beautiful hippy-backpacker village of Pai.
Trek to the Myanmar border.
West of Bangkok lies the River Kwai.
Island of Koh Lanta.
Cambodia, Vietnam, Laos, Thailand, USA: Dallas, Los Angeles, Seattle, San Francisco "Love Parade", North India and Nepal.
Photos from my 2005 trip to Cambodia.
The second largest city in Cambodia, but still just a small town. This was my first stop across the border from Thailand. Not a big tourist attraction -- perfect!
Small town near the temples of Angkor. Mainly just a place for tourists, but I had some positive experiences in the town itself.
Some of the greatest religious structures on earth are scattered in this region -- including the famous Angkor Wat.
Additional pics from my first day of temple exploration.
Additional pics from my second day.
Additional pics from my third day.
Photos from the 7 days I spent in the Capital of Cambodia. Pretty rough place, but I got into it after a while.
From Phnom Penh, Cambodia, I took a boat down the Mekong to Vietnam.
Photos from my first stop in Vietnam. Just across the Cambodian border I found this great little town.
My last stop before Ho Chi Minh City. Saw a floating market and aluminum Ho.
Crazy city of Siagon.
Beautiful national park and caves.
Great city and capital of Vietnam.
Beautiful town high in the cloud covered mountains of northern Vietnam.
Came back to Hanoi for the Tet Vietnamese new year. Met so many great people, it was very hard to leave.
Photos from my trip through the center and north-west portion of Laos.
Photos of my first destination in Laos -- the quiet little capitol Vientiane.
A bit of a tourist trap, but still a beautiful town 5-7 hours north of Vientiane by bus. Had great food, beautiful scenery and conveniences like internet access.
A much smaller village 6 - 10 hours north of Luang Prabang by longtail boat. Most people just rushed through, but I enjoyed it.
An much smaller village with bamboo huts for the villagers and backpackers alike. It was 1 hour farther north from Nong Kiew. Only electricity came from private generators and there was no phones.
My trip through Udomxai and Luang Nam Tha in North West Laos.
The emerging trekking area in western Laos. Still just a small dirt-road town where just about everyone lives in bamboo huts.
Larger town (by Laos standards) on the border with Thailand. Place to catch the boats east to Luang Prabang.
Half way to Luang Prabang is Pakbeng where we spent the night.
Tourist town, but pretty nice nevertheless. A World Heritage Site and great place to shop for Lao Silk, swim in waterfalls and eat good food!
backpacker's ghetto AKA the "Khaosan Road" of Laos. But also a pretty beautiful area!
Crossed into Thailand via Nong Khai.
Took a trip with my mother to see her hometown of Irving, Texas near Dallas.
Took Greyhound down to Los Angeles for a week. Then from LA I flew up to Seattle, Washington and drove back to San Francisco with Dillon and Andrea.
Second annual Love Parade in San Francisco. A smaller version of the famous rave in Berlin, Germany.
The beginning of my 14 month journey through South Asia. A quick stopover in Taipei, Taiwan in my way to India. Also the last meat I ate before becoming vegetarian!
Delhi, India.
The famous Taj Mahal and infamous town of Agra. Agra turned out to be a nice town full of friendly people despite the warnings of scammers, cheats, robbers, ogres, witches and monsters.
Two amazing months traveling the length of Nepal. Includes photos Kathmandu and my 3-week trek in the Annapurna mountain range.
Bardia National Park in western Nepal.
Buddhist Thangka paintings by CG Lama who I met in Pokhara, Nepal.
3.5 week adventure trekking through the Himalayas!
A few weeks exploring the Kathmandu Valley including a volunteer position in Bhaktapur.
14 months in South Asia: India, Nepal, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia, Bangkok and Myanmar. Also Zürich.
Architectural pics of the National Assembly building designed by Louis I. Khan in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
Photos from my travels around the country of Bangladesh.
4.5 months traveling in, out and through India (overland). Includes Sikkim, Calcutta, Varanasi, North India, Mumbai, and various places down south until Kerala on the southern tip.
Extra photos for Sikkim and Darjeeling.
Pictures from my time wandering around Kolkata -- what many people believe to be India's cultural capital.
A month spent wandering around North India including the holy Hindu city of Varanasi (Bernares) in Uttar Pradesh and Temples of Khajuraho and Orchha in the state of Madhya Pradesh.
A random selection of Bollywood's best for your enjoyment.
Travels through Rajasthan (Jaisalmer / camel safari, Jodhpur and Udaipur) and Mumbai (AKA Bombay) India.
Delicious South India foods, spices and tea/coffee plantations of Kerala.
My travels from central to South India including the Ajanta and Ellora caves, Bangalore, Mysore and many places in the state of Kerala.
2 months on the island of Sri Lanka (formerly Ceylon). Volunteering, beaches, jungle and hill country with Nina.
Travels from Sri Lanka, east to Malaysia, then south to Singapore and Finally Bali, Indonesia. Met up with Chloe in Bali and we traveled on to Lombok and Gili Air.
If that wasn't enough pictures for you, here are some additional pics of Bali and Lombok.
Travels through west Bali, Indonesia.
The Indonesian Island of Java. Bike parade, magical volcanoes, temples, street art and much more!
The Indonesian island of Sumatra. A crusty voyage from Jakarta to Padang, Lake Toba, motorbikes, exotic flowers and fun in Medan.
Back to the mainland of Southeast Asia. Travels up through Malaysia and into Thailand and adventures in Bangkok!
5 weeks traveling south to north through Myanmar.
Back to the Western World: 3 weeks in Zürich, Switzerland.

6 months back in the USA then Switzerland, and a bicycle trip through: Hungary, Croatia, Serbia, Bulgaria, Greece, Turkey. More travel through Slovakia, Austria, Romania and back for a wedding in Geneva.
Back to the U.S.A. after 14 months on in Asia.
Nina's visit to California.
6 months back in SF: My great house, friends, family and working at macys.com again.
A few pics from the 5 weeks I was in Zürich.
The start of my journey through Eastern Europe. Bought a cheap bike in Budapest and headed towards Istanbul.
Crossing the Hungarian border into Croatia and cycling through Slovonia.
Ignoring the warnings, I made my way into Serbia and cycled through the country for 9 days.
Warmer weather met me as I entered Bulgaria (from Serbia) and made my way east for 10 days.
A one day detour through Greece after 15 years. As a teenager I had spent a summer on the island of Hydra, but had not returned since.
The beautiful country of Türkiye! Wonderful people and excitement as I approached the end of my cycling adventure in Istanbul.
Turkish dance music!
Traveling with Nina to Slovakia - Adventures in the High Tatra mountains and her family roots in Bratislava.
Back to the comforts of western Europe. Beautiful cafe's, architecture and romance.
Nina returns to Switzerland and I round out my survey of the south-east with a trip through Transylvania and on to Bucureşti.
My unofficial step brother's wedding in Geneva!
November and December in our village of Sünikon (Near Steinmaur on the outskirts of Zürich) and pics from "Zwergenburg".
Winter in Switzerland, a visit from Jason Shiga, Berlin and a 3 month Nordic Journey from Switzerland to San Francisco (via Scandinavia, Iceland and Canada).
A trip to Tichino -- the southern "Italian" portion of Switzerland. Mountain walks and our friend Miach's cabin with a wood burning stove at the "Casa Gialla" in Altirolo.
A visit from my old friend Jason Shiga and a trip he, I and Nina took to Berlin and later the Baltic Sea.
Nina's friends Tina and David and their newborn baby Nanoy. A weekend on Mt. Rigi an snow hike down.
A flash mob invasion of Zürich. Saturday morning shoppers eaten by the undead.
Switzerland's stones.
The surprise premier of Corinne's new film at the Flözer house.
Hiking in the Jura mountains with Tim and Nina. A short trip across the border to France.
7 beautiful weeks in Kreuzberg, Berlin!
Exploring abandoned mental hospitals in the forest outside Berlin.
The beginning of our 3-month journey to San Francisco from Switzerland. First we took a train from Zürich to Hamburg, then began hitchhiking north.
By nightfall, we had hitchhiked our way onto a Danish ferry and continued via train and hitchhiking north.
Entered Sweden at night from Copenhagen and continued going north.
Traveling north-west from Oslo across the mountains to Bergen (on the North Sea).
We took a 3-day ferry from Bergen, Norway to the Faeroe Islands (Føroyar) and then on to Iceland.
5 weeks in Ísland after arriving by ferry (from Norway). Volunteering and exploring the stunning natural landscape.
Hitchhiking from the far east of Canada (Halifax), up through New Brunswick and over through Québec finally ending up in Montréal for a month.
Finally made it into the USA and spent week in The City!
A quick stopover to see what all the fuss is about. Why are there so many musicians and artists from Baltimore?
3 days crossing the USA from Washington DC to San Francisco on Amtrak trains.
San Francisco, Venice and Verona Italy, and an overland adventure from my home in Switzerland to the African continent. A visit to Berlin and Ticino in October.
Nina and I in SF and her mother's visit.
Nina came back for 2 weeks for her birthday. We went camping in the Calistoga area (Harbin Hot Springs), Clear Lake and Santa Cruz Mountains where we saw amazing redwoods!
Visiting Nick, Alexis, Kathryn and then over to Oxnard for George's birthday.
We took a trip out to Oxnard to visit George and Alice and celebrate George's birthday.
Visiting my family with some old friends.
Random photos of friends and buildings.
Nina surprised me by planning a trip to Venice for my 33rd birthday. Also couch-surfing in Verona.
Another trip to the inspirational city.
Visiting Miach and Sandra in Spruga, Switzerland.
Barcelona and Malaga - The beginning of my overland + sea adventure to Morocco.
6 weeks exploring Morocco.
Switzerland: Wängi & New Years in Soglio, Maggia Ticino, Italy, Berlin Germany and Poland. Finally Christmas in the Jura mountains.
New Years Eve in an alpine village. Also a walk through Wängi a few days later.
A weekend in Ticino with my friend Steffi.
A week in Berlin Germany...
A week traveling around northern Poland.
Traveling south to Napoli, Amalfi coast and then Rome.
Nina and I spent Christmas in a hut in the Jura Mountains, then took a trip to Neuchâtel.
Berlin, Road trip in CA, a wedding and my Swiss life...
Road trip and camping in California: Bottchers Gap, Los Padres National Forest and Pinnacles National Monument.
A quick trip to Berlin to recharge my creativity.
My brother Nick got married!
A day in Boston with my cousin.
Business trip to Berlin as part of Google Developer Day. Also had some fun when not working.
Trip over land and Sea down through Italy, over to Corfu (Greece), then up the coast of Albania. Another trip to England and Ireland from Switzerland and a couple trips to Berlin, Germany.
Traveling down through Italy and over to Corfu (Greece) by ferry for a week.
One week exploring Albania after a holiday in Greece, then back to Switzerland via Italy.
A quick trip to Berlin, Germany alone.
Trip to Berlin with Nina for my birthday.
Traveling from Switzerland to England and then Ireland without flying.
First time in Ireland
New Years in California, Germany, overland trip to Granada, Spain via Barcelona and Paris, France.
Christmas and New Years in California with Nina.
One day stopover in Dresden after 17 years away.
Visit to Berlin with Nina.
Holidays in Barcelona, Spain on our way to Granada and the Alpujarras.
Granada city and Hiking in the Alpujarras mountain range and villages around Granada.
Montmartre, Paris... just a couple days enjoying cafes, etc on our way back from spain.
Berlin, New York and California.
Two months backpacking in Colombia and some time in California.
Two months backpacking and visiting friends in Colombia.
Visiting family in California.
Languages, graphics, illustrations, videos and items not organized by date.
3D computer-generated graphics I created back in the 90's.
Our new home in Switzerland : 2011 - 2012
Funny advertisements from Switzerland.
Graphics, posters, stickers, parody, etc.
Propaganda posters exploring the connection between the Chernobyl nuclear disaster and the eventual fall of the Soviet Union.
Parodies of common corporate logos.
Linguistic survival kits for the 11 Asian + 8 European countries. These were built while traveling and are likely to contain factual errors. (Should be printed at 300 dpi)
Random pics of friends
Small video clips from my travels.
Older photos of my family's house as it was under construction in Willits, California.
Photos of my family's house in Willits, CA. Mostly Construction photos with details highlighting the Straw-bale insulation technique.
Additional photos of family and construction.
A year later - after the walls of the house are sealed.
